thread.title: Haixia Fund Said to Price $817 Million Haitong Sale at Low End
thread.title_full: Haixia Fund Said to Price $817 Million Haitong Sale at Low End - Bloomberg Business

author: Fox Hu
title: Haixia Fund Said to Price $817 Million Haitong Sale at Low End
text:
Haixia Capital Management Co., a Chinese state-backed investment firm, raised $817 million selling its entire stake in Haitong Securities Co. at the bottom end of a marketed range, a person with knowledge of the matter said.
A fund managed by Haixia Capital sold 569.4 million shares of the Chinese brokerage at HK$11.12 apiece, the person said, asking not to be identified as the information is private. The price represents a 20 percent discount to Haitong’s last close in Hong Kong.
Haixia Capital offloaded its stake at a loss after a 45 percent plunge in Haitong’s Hong Kong-traded shares over the past month. A flurry of measures to stabilize the Chinese stock market, including a pledge by state-run financial firms to buy 120 billion yuan ($19.3 billion) of shares and a halt to initial public offerings, is failing to stop a rout that erased more than $3.2 trillion of value.
The fund manager, backed by government-owned State Development & Investment Corp., bought the Haitong shares earlier this year at HK$17.18 each, as part of a $4.2 billion stock sale completed in May, Hong Kong exchange filings show.
Haixia Capital offered the shares to investors at HK$11.12 to HK$12 apiece, according to terms for the deal obtained by Bloomberg on Tuesday. It doesn’t own any further stake in Haitong after the sale. UBS Group AG was sole bookrunner for the disposal.
Shares of Haitong were suspended from trading in Hong Kong on Wednesday, after closing down 13 percent at HK$13.90 the day before. No reason has been given yet for the halt.
A woman in the administrative department of Haixia Capital’s board office, who declined to give her name when reached by phone, said nobody was available to immediately comment.
